Linking Providers

Source: vignettes/linking_providers.Rmd
linking_providers.Rmd
library(provider)
library(tidyverse)

Exploring links between providers can lead to many interesting insights. For example, there is a hospital in New York named Elizabethtown Community Hospital.


Looking it up in the Provider Enrollment API gives us several avenues to go down:


provider_enrollment(organization_name = "Elizabethtown Community Hospital")
npi pac_id enroll_id specialty_code specialty state organization_name
1891785184 3577554138 O20040521000534 12-70 PART B SUPPLIER - CLINIC/GROUP PRACTICE NY ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL
1891785184 3577554138 O20101110000259 00-85 PART A PROVIDER - CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL NY ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL
1487923637 3577554138 O20190719002511 12-59 PART B SUPPLIER - AMBULANCE SERVICE SUPPLIER NY ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL
1407061591 3577554138 O20220827000145 00-85 PART A PROVIDER - CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL NY ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL 
hospital_enrollment(organization_name = "Elizabethtown Community Hospital") |> 
  select(npi, organization_name, pac_id_org, facility_ccn, specialty_code)
npi organization_name pac_id_org facility_ccn specialty_code
1891785184 ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL 3577554138 331302 00-85
1407061591 ELIZABETHTOWN COMMUNITY HOSPITAL 3577554138 33Z302 00-85


The Hospital Enrollment API includes only Medicare Part A (hospital) providers, so we only get two rows back, but those include a new data point: two facility CCNs. Plugging those into the Facility Affiliations API, we can retrieve information on the individual providers practicing at this hospital. First, the all-numeric CCN (331302):


facility_affiliations(facility_ccn = 331302) |> 
  select(-c(middle_name, suffix)) |> 
  head(10)
npi pac_id_ind first_name last_name facility_type facility_ccn
1003815184 4082693676 ARMIN AFSAR KESHMIRI Hospital 331302
1023076643 5698798452 JOHN HENRY Hospital 331302
1043245657 7810891009 MARK FUNG Hospital 331302
1043397656 4183764558 ANTHONY TRAMONTANO Hospital 331302
1043630510 2365749389 RYAN WOLFE Hospital 331302
1053596122 5193802213 TANYA FINCH Hospital 331302
1053863100 8729362207 MATTHEW FARNSWORTH Hospital 331302
1063592210 0042228009 ROBERT PITTS Hospital 331302
1073099172 0547519381 BROOKE MAGGY Hospital 331302
1073585055 0749217313 TODD WHITMAN Hospital 331302


That returns individual providers affiliated with the hospital. Now to search the alphanumeric CCN (33Z302):

facility_affiliations(facility_ccn = "33Z302")
npi pac_id_ind first_name middle_name last_name facility_type facility_ccn parent_ccn
1396989059 8921259557 MARY K HALLORAN Nursing home 33Z302 331302
1538173869 0547299091 IL JUN CHON Nursing home 33Z302 331302
1801893318 3577568724 ROB L DEMURO Nursing home 33Z302 331302


That returns more affiliated individual providers that practice in the Hospital’s nursing home..


An alphanumeric CCN represents a sub-unit of the hospital, here a nursing home. We would get the same result if we’d set the parent_ccn argument to the numeric CCN, i.e. facility_affiliations(parent_ccn = 331302)
